_comment: Copy this file to dlp-import-mapping.json and fill in your target-tenant values.
_comment2: dlp-import-mapping.json is listed in .gitignore — never commit real GUIDs.
//1: Characters listed here are replaced in policy/rule names before import.
//2: If this section is omitted the built-in default set is used: | : / \ < > " ' ? *
//4: When -LocationsToAll is used, every non-All location value is replaced with 'All'.
//5: Exception arrays (e.g. ExchangeLocationException) are replaced with this group.
//6: Set to a real distribution group / mail-enabled security group UPN in the target.
//8: Keys = source EndpointDlpLocation/Exception group IDs, values = target IDs.
//9: ─── Transform 4: External domain exceptions → exemption group ─────────────────
//10: ExchangeLocationException entries that look like domains are replaced by this ID.
//11: Set to the UPN or ObjectId of the global DLP exemption group in the target tenant.
//13: Keys = source SIT GUIDs, values = corresponding target SIT GUIDs.
//14: Find source GUIDs in the export JSON: ContentContainsSensitiveInformation[].id
//16: Keys = source label GUIDs, values = target label GUIDs.
//17: These are used in DLP rules that reference sensitivity labels as conditions.
//19: Keys = source EvidenceStorage or IncidentReportDestination values (SharePoint site
//20: URLs or storage IDs), values = corresponding target tenant values.
//21: Applied to both EvidenceStorage and IncidentReportDestination fields on each rule.
//22: Find source values with: Get-DlpComplianceRule | Select Name,EvidenceStorage,IncidentReportDestination
